hero.title: Equipment Keeps Disappearing. Inspections Get Missed. Fines Pile Up.
hero.subtitle: Upload your spreadsheet as-is. Print tracking codes. Know where every piece of equipment is. Built for French equipment rental companies.

1.title: Upload Any Spreadsheet in 5 Minutes
1.text: Don't clean up your file first. Messy columns? Blank cells? We'll handle it. Just upload and go.

2.title: Print 500 Tracking Codes in 30 Seconds
2.text: Get a print-ready PDF instantly. Stick codes on your equipment and you're done.

3.title: Start Tracking in Hours
3.text: Most companies take weeks to get started. With TraviXO, you're typically tracking equipment the same day.

problem.title: Equipment Rental Companies Lose €50K-200K Annually
problem.subtitle: Poor tracking and manual processes are costing you money

1.title: 1-2% Equipment Loss Every Year
1.text: For a €5M fleet, that's €50K-100K written off as 'missing' annually. Equipment vanishes between sites or gets misplaced.

2.title: €50K+ Per Quarterly Audit
2.text: Flying auditors to locations, manual counts, 2 weeks reconciling spreadsheets. Every quarter. And you still find errors.

3.title: VGP Compliance Nightmares
3.text: One missed inspection = €15K+ DIRECCTE fine. Managing inspection schedules in spreadsheets means missed deadlines.

4.title: 40+ Hours of Setup Time
4.text: Traditional systems require weeks of manual data entry. By the time you're done entering data, it's already outdated.

solution.title: TraviXO: Start Tracking in Hours, Not Weeks
solution.subtitle: Simple QR tracking that works in the real world

1.title: Upload Spreadsheet
1.text: Upload your file exactly as it is. We figure out the columns automatically. 500 assets imported in 5 minutes.

2.title: Print QR Codes
2.text: Select all assets, click generate. Get a PDF with 500 tracking codes in 30 seconds. Print and stick.

3.title: Scan with Any Phone
3.text: No app needed. Workers scan with any smartphone. See location, status, and history instantly.

4.title: Avoid Compliance Fines
4.text: Automatic VGP reminders help prevent €15K+ fines. Never miss an inspection deadline.

finalCta.title: Ready to Reduce Equipment Loss?
finalCta.subtitle: Join French equipment rental companies that are tracking equipment and meeting VGP compliance requirements.

hero.title: About TraviXO
hero.subtitle: Built by equipment rental veterans who experienced these problems firsthand

story.title: Our Story
story.paragraph1: TraviXO was born from real experience. One of us worked in IT support at industry leaders. Even the best companies face the same challenges: tracking thousands of assets, keeping accurate counts, managing audits. We realized the right tool didn't exist.
story.paragraph2: The other came from payroll management, where every detail matters and compliance is mandatory. This methodical approach to accuracy and reliability became TraviXO's foundation.
story.paragraph3: By combining field experience with process management expertise, we built a tool that works for both technicians and decision-makers:

list.item3: Reliable enough to prevent thousands in losses

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Help companies know where their equipment is without weeks of spreadsheet work. TraviXO makes asset tracking simple, streamlines audits, and helps you go from spreadsheet to tracking in hours.

efficiency.title: Speed Matters
efficiency.description: Every minute spent fighting with software is time stolen from real work. We build for speed and simplicity.

realWorld.title: Built for Reality
realWorld.description: Networks fail, data is messy, teams change. TraviXO works in these conditions, not just in perfect demos.

transparency.title: Total Transparency
transparency.description: Clear pricing, exportable data, zero vendor lock-in. You own your information.

customerFirst.title: Customer-Driven
customerFirst.description: Every feature comes from a real problem experienced by customers or by us before TraviXO.

founders.title: Our Background

list.item1: An IT support specialist from demanding equipment environments
list.item2: A payroll management expert ensuring process reliability and compliance

founders.conclusion: TraviXO is developed in Paris, hosted in Europe, and GDPR compliant. Our goal is simple: help any company managing equipment know what they have, where it is, and who has it.

questions.question: Why is VGP compliance not included in the Starter plan?
questions.answer: The Starter plan is designed for basic tracking only. VGP compliance requires advanced features (inspection scheduling, certificate management, DIRECCTE reporting) available from the Professional plan onwards. For French equipment rental companies, we strongly recommend the Professional plan.

questions.question: What's the difference between monthly and annual billing?
questions.answer: Annual billing offers a 15% discount compared to monthly payments. For example, the Professional plan costs €14,400/year with annual billing, versus €1,412/month with monthly billing (€16,944/year total).

questions.question: Can I change plans at any time?
questions.answer: Yes, you can upgrade your plan at any time. Downgrades are possible at the end of your annual billing period. Contact our team to discuss your specific situation.

questions.question: Are extensions compatible with all plans?
questions.answer: The Extra Assets Pack is available for all plans. Other extensions (predictive maintenance, ERP integrations, priority SLA) require the Professional plan or higher.

questions.question: Do you offer a trial period?
questions.answer: Yes, we offer a 30-day trial period for all plans with full access to features. No credit card required to start.

section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.paragraph1: TraviXO Systems ("TraviXO," "we," "us," or "our") operates travixosystems.com and provides QR-based asset tracking software. We are committed to protecting your personal data and respecting your privacy rights under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other applicable data protection laws.
section1.paragraph2: This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, store, and protect your information when you use our website and services.

section2.title: 2. Data Controller
section2.intro: The data controller responsible for your personal data is:

subsection1.title: 3.1 Information You Provide
subsection1.intro: We collect information you voluntarily provide when you:
subsection1.item1: Fill out contact forms (name, email, company, phone number, message)
subsection1.item4: Subscribe to our newsletter or updates
subsection1.item5: Communicate with us via email or phone

subsection2.title: 3.2 Automatically Collected Information
subsection2.intro: When you visit our website, we automatically collect:
subsection2.item1: IP address and geographic location (country/city level)
subsection2.item4: Pages visited and time spent on pages

subsection3.title: 3.3 Cookies and Tracking Technologies
subsection3.content: We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience. See our Cookie Policy for details.

section4.title: 4. How We Use Your Information
section4.item2: Respond to your inquiries and support requests
section4.item3: Send you updates, newsletters, and promotional materials (with your consent)
section4.item4: Analyze website usage and optimize performance
section4.item6: Detect and prevent fraud or security issues

section5.title: 5. Legal Basis for Processing (GDPR)
section5.intro: We process your data based on:
section5.item1: Consent: When you provide explicit consent (e.g., newsletter signup)
section5.item2: Contractual Necessity: To provide Services you requested
section5.item3: Legitimate Interests: To improve our Services, prevent fraud, and ensure security
section5.item4: Legal Obligations: To comply with laws and regulations

section6.title: 6. Data Sharing and Disclosure
section6.paragraph1: We do not sell your personal data. We may share your data with:

subsection1.title: 6.1 Service Providers
subsection1.content: We work with third-party providers for hosting, analytics, email delivery, and payment processing. These providers are bound by confidentiality agreements and may only use your data as instructed.

subsection2.title: 6.2 Legal Requirements
subsection2.content: We may disclose your data if required by law, court order, or government request, or to protect our rights, safety, or property.

subsection3.title: 6.3 Business Transfers
subsection3.content: If TraviXO is involved in a merger, acquisition, or sale of assets, your data may be transferred. We will notify you before your data is transferred and becomes subject to a different Privacy Policy.

section7.title: 7. Data Retention
section7.content: We retain your data only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy or as required by law. Account data is retained while your account is active. Contact form data is retained for up to 2 years. Analytics data is anonymized and retained indefinitely.

section8.title: 8. Your Rights (GDPR)
section8.intro: Under GDPR, you have the right to:
section8.item1: Access: Request a copy of your personal data
section8.item2: Rectification: Correct inaccurate or incomplete data
section8.item3: Erasure: Request deletion of your data ("right to be forgotten")
section8.item4: Restriction: Limit how we process your data
section8.item5: Portability: Receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format
section8.item6: Object: Object to processing based on legitimate interests
section8.item7: Withdraw Consent: Withdraw consent at any time (does not affect prior processing)
section8.footer: To exercise these rights, contact us at contact@travixosystems.com.

section9.title: 9. Data Security
section9.paragraph1: We implement reasonable technical and organizational measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. These include encryption, secure servers, and access controls.
section9.paragraph2: However, no method of transmission over the internet or electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to protect your data, we cannot guarantee absolute security.

section10.title: 10. International Data Transfers
section10.content: Your data may be transferred to and processed in countries outside the European Economic Area (EEA). We ensure that such transfers comply with GDPR by using Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) or ensuring the recipient country has adequate data protection laws.

section11.title: 11. Children's Privacy
section11.content: Our Services are not intended for individuals under the age of 16. We do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If we become aware that we have collected data from a child, we will delete it promptly.

section12.title: 12. Cookies and Tracking
section12.paragraph1: We use cookies to enhance your experience, analyze traffic, and personalize content. Cookies are small text files stored on your device.

types.title: Types of Cookies We Use:
types.essential: Essential Cookies: Required for the website to function
types.analytics: Analytics Cookies: Help us understand how visitors use our site (e.g., Google Analytics)
types.marketing: Marketing Cookies: Track your activity to show relevant ads

section12.footer: You can manage cookie preferences through your browser settings. Disabling cookies may affect website functionality.

section13.title: 13. Third-Party Links
section13.content: Our website may contain links to third-party sites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of these sites. We encourage you to review their privacy policies.

section14.title: 14. Changes to This Privacy Policy
section14.paragraph1: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of material changes by posting the updated policy on this page with a new "Last Updated" date or by sending an email notification.
section14.paragraph2: Your continued use of the Services after changes take effect constitutes acceptance of the updated Privacy Policy.

section15.title: 15. Contact Us
section15.intro: If you have questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your rights, contact us:

section1.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
section1.paragraph1: Welcome to TraviXO Systems ("TraviXO," "we," "us," or "our"). By accessing or using our website (travixosystems.com) and services (collectively, the "Services"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service ("Terms"). If you do not agree to these Terms, you may not use the Services.
section1.paragraph2: These Terms apply to all users, including visitors, customers, and anyone who accesses the Services.

section2.title: 2. Eligibility
section2.intro: To use the Services, you must:
section2.item1: Be at least 18 years old or the age of majority in your jurisdiction
section2.item2: Have the legal authority to enter into binding contracts
section2.item3: Not be prohibited from using the Services under applicable law
section2.footer: By using the Services, you represent and warrant that you meet these requirements.

subsection1.title: 3.1 Account Creation
subsection1.content: To access certain features, you may need to create an account. You agree to provide accurate, current, and complete information during registration and to update it as necessary.

subsection2.title: 3.2 Account Security
subsection2.item1: Maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials
subsection2.item2: All activities that occur under your account
subsection2.item3: Notifying us immediately of any unauthorized access or security breach
subsection2.footer: We are not liable for any loss or damage arising from your failure to protect your account.

subsection3.title: 3.3 Account Termination
subsection3.content: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your account if you violate these Terms or engage in fraudulent, abusive, or illegal activity.

subsection1.title: 4.1 Pricing
subsection1.content: Our pricing plans are listed on travixosystems.com/pricing. Prices are subject to change, but we will notify you before any changes affect your subscription.

subsection2.title: 4.2 Billing and Renewal
subsection2.content: Subscriptions automatically renew at the end of each billing period unless you cancel before the renewal date. You will be charged using your payment method on file.

subsection3.title: 4.3 Refunds
subsection3.content: We offer a 14-day money-back guarantee for first-time subscribers. After 14 days, fees are non-refundable. Refunds for unused portions of annual subscriptions are prorated if you cancel mid-term.

subsection4.title: 4.4 Late Payment
subsection4.content: If payment fails, we will attempt to charge your payment method up to 3 times. If payment is not received within 7 days, your account may be suspended. We may charge a late fee of €25 or 5% of the outstanding balance, whichever is greater.

subsection1.title: 5.1 Your Right to Cancel
subsection1.content: You may cancel your subscription at any time by contacting us or using the cancellation feature in your account settings. Cancellation takes effect at the end of your current billing period.

subsection2.title: 5.2 Our Right to Terminate
subsection2.intro: We may suspend or terminate your account if you:
subsection2.item2: Fail to pay fees when due
subsection2.item3: Engage in fraudulent or illegal activity
subsection2.item4: Use the Services in a way that harms TraviXO or other users
subsection2.footer: We will provide reasonable notice before termination unless immediate termination is required for legal or security reasons.

subsection3.title: 5.3 Effect of Termination
subsection3.content: Upon termination, your access to the Services will cease. You will have 30 days to export your data before it is permanently deleted. Fees paid are non-refundable except as stated in Section 4.3.

section6.title: 6. Acceptable Use Policy
section6.item1: Use the Services for any illegal purpose
section6.item2: Attempt to gain unauthorized access to our systems
section6.item3: Reverse engineer, decompile, or disassemble the Services
section6.item4: Upload malicious code, viruses, or malware
section6.item5: Interfere with or disrupt the Services or servers
section6.item6: Resell or redistribute the Services without authorization
section6.item7: Use the Services to infringe on intellectual property rights

subsection1.title: 7.1 Our Ownership
subsection1.content: TraviXO retains all rights, title, and interest in the Services, including all software, designs, trademarks, and documentation. These Terms do not grant you any ownership rights.

subsection2.title: 7.2 Your Content
subsection2.paragraph1: You retain ownership of all data you upload to TraviXO ("Customer Data"). You grant us a limited license to store, process, and display your data solely to provide the Services.
subsection2.paragraph2: You represent that you have the right to upload Customer Data and that it does not violate any laws or third-party rights.

subsection3.title: 7.3 Feedback
subsection3.content: If you provide feedback, suggestions, or ideas about the Services, we may use them without obligation to you.

section8.title: 8. Data Protection and Privacy
section8.paragraph1: Our collection and use of personal data is governed by our Privacy Policy. By using the Services, you consent to our data practices as described in the Privacy Policy.
section8.paragraph2: We implement reasonable security measures to protect your data, but we cannot guarantee absolute security. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials.

section9.title: 9. Service Level and Availability
section9.paragraph1: We strive to provide reliable Services but do not guarantee uninterrupted access. The Services are provided "as is" and "as available." We may perform maintenance that temporarily affects availability, and we will provide advance notice when possible.

sla.title: Service Level Agreement (SLA):
sla.content: Enterprise customers receive a 99.9% uptime SLA as specified in their contract. Other plans do not include an SLA.

section10.title: 10. Limitation of Liability
section10.intro: To the fullest extent permitted by law:
section10.paragraph1: TraviXO and its affiliates, officers, employees, and agents will not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, including loss of profits, revenue, data, or use, arising from:
section10.item1: Your use of or inability to use the Services
section10.item3: Errors, bugs, or interruptions in the Services
section10.paragraph2: Our total liability to you for any claim arising from these Terms or the Services will not exceed the fees you paid in the 12 months preceding the claim.
section10.paragraph3: Some jurisdictions do not allow exclusion of certain warranties or limitations on liability, so these limitations may not apply to you.

section11.title: 11. Indemnification
section11.intro: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless TraviXO from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, and expenses (including legal fees) arising from:
section11.item3: Your violation of any laws or third-party rights
section11.item4: Customer Data you upload to the Services

subsection1.title: 12.1 Governing Law
subsection1.content: These Terms are governed by the laws of France, without regard to conflict of law principles.

subsection2.title: 12.2 Jurisdiction
subsection2.content: Any disputes arising from these Terms or the Services will be resolved exclusively in the courts of Paris, France. You consent to the personal jurisdiction of these courts.

subsection3.title: 12.3 Informal Resolution
subsection3.content: Before filing a legal claim, you agree to contact us at contact@travixosystems.com to attempt to resolve the dispute informally.

section13.title: 13. Changes to These Terms
section13.intro: We may update these Terms from time to time. We will notify you of material changes by:
section13.method1: Posting the updated Terms on this page with a new "Last Updated" date
section13.method2: Sending an email notification (for active customers)
section13.footer: Your continued use of the Services after changes take effect constitutes acceptance of the updated Terms. If you do not agree to the changes, you must cancel your subscription.

subsection1.title: 14.1 Entire Agreement
subsection1.content: These Terms, together with our Privacy Policy, constitute the entire agreement between you and TraviXO regarding the Services.

subsection2.title: 14.2 Severability
subsection2.content: If any provision of these Terms is found to be unenforceable, the remaining provisions will continue in full force and effect.

subsection3.title: 14.3 Waiver
subsection3.content: Our failure to enforce any right or provision of these Terms will not be deemed a waiver of that right or provision.

subsection4.title: 14.4 Assignment
subsection4.content: You may not assign these Terms without our prior written consent. We may assign these Terms without restriction.

subsection5.title: 14.5 Force Majeure
subsection5.content: Neither party will be liable for any delay or failure to perform due to causes beyond its reasonable control (e.g., natural disasters, war, pandemics, government actions).
